required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of PRO-155 Ophthalmic Solution 0.09% in Healthy Volunteers.
clinical_study.official_title: Fase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of PRO-155 Ophthalmic Solution 0.09% in Healthy Volunteers.

brief_summary.textblock: Study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of PRO-155 Ophthalmic Solution 0.09 % in healthy volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: A phase I, open label and unicentric clinical trial to evaluate the safety and tolerability of PRO-155 Ophthalmic Solution 0.09 % in healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.description: A Snellen chart is an eye chart that can be used to measure visual acuity. consisting of a scale ranging from 20 to 200, where 20 is the best visual capacity and 200 is the worst

secondary_outcome.description: will be reported the presence of adverse events presented in the study group during the intervention period .
Abnormal bores will be reported when assessing the integrity of the posterior segment, the unit of measure will be number of findings.
Intraocular pressure (IOP) measurement by applanation tonometry. The unit of measurement will be millimeters of mercury (mmhg) the normal range will be considered 11 to 21 mmhg.
The red eye will be evaluated by the absence or presence of hyperemia.
Eye ocular burning will be reported according to the following scale: absent, mild, moderate and severe.
Tearing will be reported according to the following scale: absent, mild, moderate and severe.
Foreign body sensation will be reported according to the following scale: absent, mild, moderate and severe.
photophobia will be reported according to the following scale: absent, mild, moderate and severe.
chemosis will be reported according to the following scale: absent, mild, moderate and severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Corneal Damage by Fluorescein Staining Test
secondary_outcome.description: Corneal damage will be reported by Fluorescein eye staining using the following scale: absent, mild, moderate, and severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Corneal Damage by Lissamine Green Staining Test
secondary_outcome.description: Corneal damage will be reported by lissamine green staining using the following scale: absent, mild, moderate, and severe.

arm_group.description: Drug: Bromfenac ophthalmic solution 1 drop 4 times per day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female.
- Age ≥ 18 years old at screening visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any ocular or systemic condition.
- Patient with one blind eye.
- Visual acuity of 20/40 in any eye.
- Use of ocular or systemic medications.
- Contraindications or sensitivity to any component of the study treatments.
- Contact lens users.
- Ocular surgery within the past 3 months..
- Women who were not using an effective means of contraception or who were pregnant or nursing.
- Participation in any studies of investigational drugs within 90 days previous to the inclusion.

overall_official.affiliation: Clinical Research Department. Laboratorios Sophia SA de CV
